content.question: The British Great Reform Act of 1832 did which of the following?

choices.label: Gave women the right to vote.
Limited the power of the monarchy.
Abolished the right of the House of Lords to veto legislation.
Increased the voting power of the middle class.

content.answer: Increased the voting power of the middle class.

topic.text: 6.7: Ideologies of Change and Reform Movements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
